detaileddescription.para: Mask of the ID field presence bit in the flags byte of an NDEF record.
Mask of the TNF value field in the first byte of an NDEF record.
Mask of the SR flag. If set, this flag indicates that the PAYLOAD_LENGTH field has a size of 1 byte. Otherwise, PAYLOAD_LENGTH has 4 bytes.
Size of the Payload Length field in a long NDEF record.
Size of the Payload Length field in a short NDEF record.
Mask of the Record Location bits in the NDEF record's flags byte.

memberdef.name: NFC_NDEF_GENERIC_RECORD_DESC_DEF
memberdef.initializer: struct nfc_ndef_record_desc name##_ndef_generic_record_desc = \ { \ .tnf = tnf_arg, \ .id_length = id_len, \ .id = id_arg, \ .type_length = type_len, \ .type = type_arg, \ .payload_constructor = \ (payload_constructor_t)payload_constructor_arg, \ .payload_descriptor = (void *) payload_descriptor_arg \ }

briefdescription.para: Macro for creating and initializing an NFC NDEF record descriptor for a generic record.

detaileddescription.para: This macro creates and initializes an instance of type nfc_ndef_record_desc.
Use the macro NFC_NDEF_GENERIC_RECORD_DESC to access the NDEF record descriptor instance.

simplesect.para: The record descriptor is declared as automatic variable, which implies that the NDEF record encoding must be done in the same variable scope.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the created descriptor instance.
Type Name Format (TNF) value for the record.
Pointer to the ID string.
Length of the ID string.
Pointer to the type string.
Length of the type string.
Pointer to the payload constructor function. The constructor must be of type payload_constructor_t.
Pointer to the data for the payload constructor.

briefdescription.para: Macro for accessing the NFC NDEF record descriptor instance that you created with NFC_NDEF_GENERIC_RECORD_DESC_DEF.

memberdef.name: NFC_NDEF_RECORD_BIN_DATA_DEF
memberdef.initializer: struct nfc_ndef_bin_payload_desc name##_nfc_ndef_bin_payload_desc = \ { \ .payload = payload_arg, \ .payload_length = payload_len \ }; \ \ struct nfc_ndef_record_desc name##_nfc_ndef_bin_record_desc = \ { \ .tnf = tnf_arg, \ .id_length = id_len, \ .id = id_arg, \ .type_length = type_len, \ .type = type_arg, \ .payload_constructor = \ (payload_constructor_t) nfc_ndef_bin_payload_memcopy, \ .payload_descriptor = \ (void *) &name##_nfc_ndef_bin_payload_desc \ }

briefdescription.para: Macro for creating and initializing an NFC NDEF record descriptor for a record with binary payload.

detaileddescription.para: This macro creates and initializes an instance of type nfc_ndef_record_desc and a binary data descriptor containing the payload data.
Use the macro NFC_NDEF_RECORD_BIN_DATA to access the NDEF record descriptor instance.

simplesect.para: The record descriptor is declared as automatic variable, which implies that the NDEF record encoding must be done in the same variable scope.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the created descriptor instance.
Type Name Format (TNF) value for the record.
Pointer to the ID string.
Length of the ID string.
Pointer to the type string.
Length of the type string.
Pointer to the payload data that will be copied to the payload field.
Length of the payload.

briefdescription.para: Macro for accessing the NFC NDEF record descriptor instance that you created with NFC_NDEF_RECORD_BIN_DATA_DEF.
Macro for accessing the binary data descriptor that contains the payload of the record that you created with NFC_NDEF_RECORD_BIN_DATA_DEF.

detaileddescription.para: The value indicates that there is no type or payload associated with this record.
NFC Forum well-known type [NFC RTD].
Media-type as defined in RFC 2046 [RFC 2046].
Absolute URI as defined in RFC 3986 [RFC 3986].
NFC Forum external type [NFC RTD].
The value indicates that there is no type associated with this record.
The value is used for the record chunks used in chunked payload.
The value is reserved for future use.
Values to specify the TNF of a record.
First record.
Middle record.
Last record.
Only one record in the message.

briefdescription.para: Record position within the NDEF message.

detaileddescription.para: Values to specify the location of a record within the NDEF message.
A payload constructor is a function for constructing the payload of an NDEF record.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the input data for the constructor.
Pointer to the payload destination. If NULL, function will calculate the expected size of the record payload. *

Size of the available memory to write as input. Size of the generated record payload as output. The implementation must check if the payload will fit in the provided buffer. This must be checked by the caller function.
If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nfc_ndef_record_desc const *ndef_record_desc, enum nfc_ndef_record_location const record_location, uint8_t *record_buffer, uint32_t *record_len)
memberdef.name: nfc_ndef_record_encode

detaileddescription.para: This function encodes an NDEF record according to the provided record descriptor.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the record descriptor.
Location of the record within the NDEF message.
Pointer to the record destination. If NULL, function will calculate the expected size of the record.
Size of the available memory for the record as input. Size of the generated record as output.
If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Construct the payload for an NFC NDEF record from binary data.

detaileddescription.para: This function copies data from a binary buffer to the payload field of the NFC NDEF record.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the descriptor of the binary data location and size.
Pointer to the payload destination. If NULL, function will calculate the expected size of the record payload.
Size of the available memory for the payload as input. Size of the copied payload as output.
If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.
